com.dataartisans.flinktraining.exercises.datastream_java.utils

Class GeoUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dataartisans.flinktraining.exercises.datastream_java.utils.GeoUtils

  • public class GeoUtils
extends Object
    GeoUtils provides utility methods to deal with locations for the data streaming exercises.

    • Method Detail

      • isInNYC

        public static boolean isInNYC(float lon,
                              float lat)
        Checks if a location specified by longitude and latitude values is within the geo boundaries of New York City.
        Parameters:
        lon - longitude of the location to check
        lat - latitude of the location to check
        Returns:
        true if the location is within NYC boundaries, otherwise false.

      • mapToGridCell

        public static int mapToGridCell(float lon,
                                float lat)
        Maps a location specified by latitude and longitude values to a cell of a grid covering the area of NYC. The grid cells are roughly 100 x 100 m and sequentially number from north-west to south-east starting by zero.
        Parameters:
        lon - longitude of the location to map
        lat - latitude of the location to map
        Returns:
        id of mapped grid cell.

      • mapToGridCellsOnWay

        public static List<Integer> mapToGridCellsOnWay(float lon1,
                                                float lat1,
                                                float lon2,
                                                float lat2)
        Maps the direct path between two locations specified by longitude and latitude to a list of cells of a grid covering the area of NYC. The grid cells are roughly 100 x 100 m and sequentially number from north-west to south-east starting by zero.
        Parameters:
        lon1 - longitude of the first location
        lat1 - latitude of the first location
        lon2 - longitude of the second location
        lat2 - latitude of the second location
        Returns:
        A list of cell ids

      • getGridCellCenterLon

        public static float getGridCellCenterLon(int gridCellId)
        Returns the longitude of the center of a grid cell.
        Parameters:
        gridCellId - The grid cell.
        Returns:
        The longitude value of the cell's center.

      • getGridCellCenterLat

        public static float getGridCellCenterLat(int gridCellId)
        Returns the latitude of the center of a grid cell.
        Parameters:
        gridCellId - The grid cell.
        Returns:
        The latitude value of the cell's center.

      • getRandomNYCLon

        public static float getRandomNYCLon(Random rand)
        Returns a random longitude within the NYC area.
        Parameters:
        rand - A random number generator.
        Returns:
        A random longitude value within the NYC area.

      • getRandomNYCLat

        public static float getRandomNYCLat(Random rand)
        Returns a random latitude within the NYC area.
        Parameters:
        rand - A random number generator.
        Returns:
        A random latitude value within the NYC area.

      • getEuclideanDistance

        public static double getEuclideanDistance(float lon1,
                                          float lat1,
                                          float lon2,
                                          float lat2)
        Returns the Euclidean distance between two locations specified as lon/lat pairs.
        Parameters:
        lon1 - Longitude of first location
        lat1 - Latitude of first location
        lon2 - Longitude of second location
        lat2 - Latitude of second location
        Returns:
        The Euclidean distance between the specified locations.

      • getDirectionAngle

        public static int getDirectionAngle(float startLon,
                                    float startLat,
                                    float destLon,
                                    float destLat)
        Returns the angle in degrees between the vector from the start to the destination and the x-axis on which the start is located. The angle describes in which direction the destination is located from the start, i.e., 0째 -> East, 90째 -> South, 180째 -> West, 270째 -> North
        Parameters:
        startLon - longitude of start location
        startLat - latitude of start location
        destLon - longitude of destination
        destLat - latitude of destination
        Returns:
        The direction from start to destination location
